item.title: Roosevelt Elk
item.description: A Roosevelt Elk made by ShenTirag in 2006; originally released on Shen’s Den.

item.title: Japanese Macaque Donation Box
item.description: A donation box box designed to look like a Japanese Macaque.

item.title: Zoo Tycoon 2: Operation Genesis - Part 2
item.description: This is the second part of the Zoo Tycoon 2 Operation Genesis project.

item.title: Albertosaurus Reskin
item.description: Reskin of the Albertosaurus from the ZT2: Operation Genesis user-made expansion pack.

item.title: Killer Penguin
item.description: Makes the Killer Penguin adoptable.

item.title: Endangered Picnic Table
item.description: An endangered-themed picnic table.

item.title: Massai Fence
item.description: A massai fence for your zoo!

item.title: Stony Fence
item.description: A stony fence for your zoo!

item.title: Invisible Fences Cheat Code
item.description: Use cheat codes to make fences invisible!

item.title: UFO Ride Asset Pack
item.description: UFO Ride asset pack by Goosifer

item.title: UFO Ride
item.description: A gravitron for ZT1!

item.title: Lego's Revamped Biome System
item.description: This is the second version of the biome system, which allows designers to create biomes with different codenames, instead of using a pre-defined and numbered registry.

item.title: Balloon Animal Stand Asset Pack
item.description: This bundle includes all assets used in the creation of the Zoo Tycoon 1 Balloon Animal Stand mod by Goosifer.

item.title: Aliwalia
item.description: This huge carnivore will eat meat and fish. It can bring down small or large prey and could reach length of twelve metres.

item.title: Alpine Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Binoculars Pack
item.description: This pack contains four binoculars.

item.title: Boreal Forest Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Desert Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Elements Pack
item.description: This is a scenery pack from the creative minds of Penguinman and Budgielover101.

item.title: Grassland Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: No Zoo Wall Hack
item.description: Makes the zoo wall invisible, perfect for photography and Show & Tell threads.

item.title: Savannah Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Scrub Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Temperate Forest Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Toxodon
item.description: Toxodon (‘Archer’s bow teeth’) is a large genus of extinct South American ungulate, ecologically similar to the hippopotamus.

item.title: Tundra Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Aardwolf
item.description: Aardwolves occur solely on the continent of Africa. There are two separate populations.

item.title: Afromontane Foliage
item.description: A set of trees from African mountains made to accompany the user-made Montane Forest biome!

item.title: Asian Small-Clawed Otter
item.description: The Asian Small-Clawed Otter is a wetlands mammal. It is smaller than the Sea Otter.

item.title: Atlantic Sailfish
item.description: The Atlantic Sailfish is uber amazing: It’s also AWESOME and POINTY! (quote from ShenTirag)

item.title: Australian Spotted Jellyfish
item.description: This large and spectacular jellyfish is common during the summer months in New South Wales coastal waters and estuaries, including Sydney Harbour.

item.title: Biome Shell
item.description: Alternatives have been released over the years, but this was the original modified biome system for Zoo Tycoon 2.

item.title: Black-Backed Jackal
item.description: These animals are omnivorous and will eat carrion, as well as plants such as grass, fruit, berries and seed.

item.title: Cannonball Jellyfish
item.description: The cannonball jellyfish, also known as the cabbagehead jellyfish, is a species of jellyfish in the family Stomolophidae.

item.title: Chinese Alligator
item.description: The Chinese alligator is a crocodilian endemic to China.

item.title: Cross Jellyfish
item.description: This jelly is commonly seen in Monterey Bay during spring and summer, sometimes in large groups.

item.title: Deepwater Trachymedusa
item.description: Benthocodon pedunculata is found in deep water habitats like Monterey Canyon and San Clemente Basin on the West Coast.

item.title: Dhole II
item.description: The dhole is a species of canid native to Southeast Asia. It is the only extant member of the genus Cuon.

item.title: Dik-Dik
item.description: The coat of Kirk’s dik-dik is an overall grizzled grey-brown to reddish brown, while the head and legs are tawny in colour.

item.title: Dingo
item.description: The dingo is an Australian wild dog living in various habitats, ranging from tropical coastal beaches, inland deserts or alpine forest.

item.title: Dwarf Cassowary
item.description: Casuarius bennetti is found on the island of New Guinea. The majority of the population resides in Papua New Guinea, on the eastern side of the island.

item.title: European Pack I
item.description: The first part of our little project, contains the European Mouflon, the Highland Cow and the Shire Horse!

item.title: Exmoor Pony
item.description: The Exmoor Pony is a hardy, sturdy breed of semi-feral pony, one of many of the mountain and moorland ponies of the British Isles.

item.title: Flower Hat Jellyfish
item.description: This striking and rare jelly has brilliant, multicolored tentacles trailing from a translucent, pinstriped bell.

item.title: Fried Egg Jellyfish
item.description: This jellyfish resembles a fried egg when seen from above.

item.title: Granrojo
item.description: In photographs, it looks like a big red spaceship cruising the ocean depths.

item.title: Gray's Monitor
item.description: Gray’s monitor gets its common name from its previous scientific name of Varanus grayi.

item.title: Greater Kudu
item.description: This is the Greater Kudu, the second largest antelope in Africa.

item.title: Highland Cow Moorland Hack
item.description: Moves the highland cow to the Moorland biome.

item.title: Jackson's Mongoose
item.description: Jackson’s mongooses are typically a greyish or dull brownish in color, with the legs being black.

item.title: Leopard Tortoise
item.description: Leopard tortoises have a huge range, being found on the savannahs of Africa from the Sudan South to the Cape Province of South Africa.

item.title: Lion's Mane Jellyfish
item.description: The lion’s mane jellyfish can be found in the cooler regions of the Atlantic, Pacific, North Sea and Baltic.

item.title: Maned Wolf
item.description: The maned wolf appears as a cross among different species. Some think it looks like a mix between a wolf and a fox.

item.title: Mauve Stinger
item.description: This species of jellyfish, commonly known as mauve stinger, is widely distributed in all warm and temperate waters.

item.title: Montane Forest
item.description: Montane forests are a type of tropical moist forest that exist at higher elevations.

item.title: Montane Forest Hack
item.description: This will move the spectacled bear, mountain gorilla, and puya plant to the Montane Forest biome.

item.title: Moorland
item.description: Moorland is an upland habitat covered in low lying vegetation, such as hardy grasses and thick carpets of heather.

item.title: Purple-Striped Jellyfish
item.description: Of all the gelatinous creatures visiting Monterey Bay, the purple-striped jelly is certainly among the most recognizable and spectacular.

item.title: Red Grouse
item.description: The red grouse is differentiated by its plumage being reddish brown and not having a white winter plumage.

item.title: Red-Footed Tortoise
item.description: Also known as the South American red-footed tortoise, the males grow up to 13.5 inches (30.4 cm) and are somewhat larger than females.

item.title: South America Pack
item.description: This pack contains six animals from South America and is downloaded in one file.

item.title: Wax Palm
item.description: The wax palm (Palma de cera del quindio in Spanish) is not only the tallest palm, but the tallest monocot in the world.

item.title: Yellow Jellyfish
item.description: Due to their extreme rarity, very little is known about the yellow jellyfish.

item.title: Yellow-Footed Rock Wallaby
item.description: The yellow-footed rock wallaby is one of the brightest members of the kangaroo family.

item.title: Zorilla
item.description: The zorilla is a skunk-like mammal that lives in African savannas. It is also called the striped polecat.

item.title: Arabian Nights Location Banners
item.description: A set of banners with locations featured in Artifex’s Arabian Nights user-made expansion pack.

item.title: Crumbling Dark Brick Pack
item.description: Dark crumbling bricks are a perfect path for Halloween themed areas of your zoos. Original skin by genkicoll for ZT1, converted to ZT2 by ShenTirag.

item.title: Extinct Animal Crossing Signs
item.description: A set of nine extinct animal crossing signs that warn visitors on foot or in jeep transports that various extinct animals from around the world may cross their path.

item.title: Genkicoll's ZT1 Paths for ZT2 Pack
item.description: A selection of genkicoll’s wonderful paths that she has made for ZT1, replicated with permission for use in ZT2. Enjoy wooden, sandstone, shadowstone and other paths in your zoos!

item.title: Island Excursions Location Banners
item.description: A set of banners with locations featured in Artifex’s Arabian Nights user-made expansion pack.

item.title: Leafy Path
item.description: A path covered in newly fallen leaves, featuring leaf decorations along the curb as well. Perfect for a walk through temperate forests!

item.title: Natural Scenery Pack 1
item.description: The first of two sets aimed towards creating more realistic zoos, and my first ever user-made pack for Zoo Tycoon 2! Featuring three paths (two bark chip and one stone path), two topiaries and a bench.

item.title: Natural Scenery Pack 2
item.description: A second set of natural wooden scenery to soften the curves of a harsh city zoo. Featuring a mahogany wooden donation box, binocular set, viewing canopy and map, alongside a set of ivy covered arches including large sizes to cover wide paths. Additionally, several fallen logs are contained to give a realistic feel to a forest exhibit.

item.title: Rusty Fences
item.description: A pair of rusting metal fences, complete with chains and portholes! Perfect for placing alongside benthic animals!

item.title: Warning Signs
item.description: This small pack contains signs containing warnings and instructions to abide when visiting the zoo. It includes No Entry and Staff Only, signs reminding guests to not tap the glass or feed the animals, prohibiting flash photography, reminding guests to wash their hands and other useful signs for zoos and safari parks.

item.title: American Badger
item.description: A white dorsal stripe extends back over the head from the nose of the American badger.

item.title: Clouded Leopard
item.description: The clouded leopard is sufficiently distinct from other members of the Felidae family to be placed in a separate genus.

item.title: Eurasian Badger
item.description: Eurasian badgers are easily recognisable by the conspicuous black and white stripes running from the nose to the shoulders.

item.title: Red River Hog Pack
item.description: Red river hogs are social animals. While adults of both sexes have been known to be solitary, most live in small groups of up to eleven individuals.

item.title: Skunk
item.description: Skunks produce a very smelly spray that repels most predators. This oily, yellow liquid is produced in two glands located under the tail.

item.title: Sorraia
item.description: Sorraia horses are a remnant population of an indigenous, South Iberian wild horse.

item.title: Yunnan White-Handed Gibbon
item.description: This Yunnan white-handed gibbon was a subspecies of the lar gibbon located in the Yunnan province of China.

item.title: Chamois
item.description: They live in rocky areas and alpine meadows in Europe (especially the Alps, Carpathians) and in Asia minor.

item.title: Dodo Reskin
item.description: A dodo reskin made by Ringo.

item.title: Eastern Cougar
item.description: Cougars have been extirpated from much of their former range, especially in the east.

item.title: Japanese Macaque Pack
item.description: Japanese macaques range through the forested mountains and highlands of Japan.

item.title: Japanese Serow
item.description: Unlike its relatives, the Japanese serow’s upper coat not uniform in colour. Rather, it is mottled.

item.title: Laughing Owl
item.description: The South Island laughing owl was an endemic owl that inbabited the South Island and Stewart Islands from New Zealand.

item.title: Vicuña Pack
item.description: Vicuñas are found in semiarid rolling grasslands and plains at altitudes of 3,500-5,750 meters.

item.title: Colossochelys
item.description: Colossochelys atlas was the biggest tortoise of all time. It has a juvenile stage. Babies and juveniles will move in herds.

item.title: Dacentrurus
item.description: The Dacentrurus was a weird-looking herbivore living in Europe. One of the largest stegosaurs, it both grazed and browsed.

item.title: Desert Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Desert Theme from African Adventure.

item.title: Endangered Species Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Endangered Theme from Endangered Species.

item.title: Extinct Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Extinct Theme from Extinct Animals.

item.title: Jungle Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Jungle Theme from base Zoo Tycoon 2.

item.title: Mourasuchus
item.description: A gentle giant, this beautiful yet lethargic reptile cruised the Miocene rivers, filtering plankton and shrimp through its teeth.

item.title: Pinacosaurus
item.description: Pinacosaurus (plank lizard) is a genus of medium-sized ankylosaur dinosaurs that lived in Mongolia and China.

item.title: Pterodaustro
item.description: Pterodaustro (meaning southern wing) was a Cretaceous pterosaur from South America, living 140 million years ago.

item.title: Safari Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Safari Theme from base Zoo Tycoon 2.

item.title: Scipionyx
item.description: Scipionyx, often informally called Sippy, was significant because it was one of the few baby dinosaurs to be preserved.

item.title: Tundra Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Tundra Theme from official bonus downloads.

item.title: American Alligator Pack
item.description: American alligators are usually found in freshwater swamps, marshes, rivers, lakes, and occasionally smaller bodies of water.

item.title: Extinctionless Dimension Pack
item.description: These three animals have been brought from the fictional Extinctionless Dimension to be adoptable in your zoo!

item.title: Ganges River Dolphin Pack
item.description: The Ganges river dolphin lives in the muddy waters of the Ganges, Brahmaputra, Meghna, Karnaphuli, and Hoogly river systems.

item.title: Indian Mango Tree
item.description: An Asian fruit tree. This beautiful mango variety lives in the Indian scrublands.

item.title: Passenger Pigeon
item.description: The passenger pigeon is an extinct species of pigeon that once was the most common in North America.

item.title: Tamarind Tree
item.description: This wonderful tree will be great in Scrub and Tropical Rainforest exhibits with animals from Asia, Africa or Central America..

item.title: Yellow-Knobbed Curassow
item.description: The yellow-knobbed curassow is a large terrestrial bird that eats fruit.

item.title: African Elephant Variants
item.description: This bundle includes four African elephant variant skins made by 20pops09.

item.title: Albino Pack
item.description: A pack of eight albino variants, one each for eight different animals, made by Zooasaurus and bundled together.

item.title: Animal Bench Pack
item.description: A pack containing many benches which you can select from.

item.title: Asian Elephant Variant
item.description: An Asian elephant variant made by Brownwolf.

item.title: Bactrian Camel
item.description: The Bactrian camel is a large even-toed ungulate native to the steppes of eastern Asia.

item.title: Dorcas Gazelle and Adonis Dentata
item.description: The dorcas gazelle is highly adapted to the desert. They can go their entire lives without drinking.

item.title: Dugong
item.description: The dugong (sometimes refered to as a sea cow) is a mammal- that is, it suckles its young.

item.title: Giant Anteater
item.description: The giant anteater, Myrmecophaga tridactyla, is the largest species of anteater.

item.title: Giant Volcano
item.description: This large volcano adds some spectacular scenery to tours though the zoo.

item.title: Gray Wolf Variants
item.description: This bundle includes three gray wolf variant skins made by 20pops09.

item.title: Ibex Statue
item.description: An ibex statue for your guests to look at.

item.title: Nubian Ibex
item.description: The Nubian ibex is relatively small compared to other ibexes.

item.title: Painted Reed Frog Pack
item.description: A pack containing a wetlands mushroom, a painted reed frog and an information board.

item.title: Realistic MM2 Biomes Hack
item.description: This hack adds more realistic foliage and rock details to the Marine Mania biomes (Benthic, Coastal, Pelagic and Reef).

item.title: Shadow Wolf
item.description: Shadow Wolves are PURE black wolves that ONLY live on Princess royal island (the island of the Spirit Bear).

item.title: zFixSunia
item.description: This hack fixes hippos, pigs (warthogs), and peccaries to not chew their cud.

item.title: zHackWorldLocs
item.description: This hack adds a bit of flavor to the globe by spreading out the Tundra zoos and moving the Polar Coast zoo to the coast.

item.title: Asian Golden Cat
item.description: The Asian golden cat is a very mystical looking creature. Many Asian groups also have mystical stories and legends about this cat.

item.title: Box Turtle
item.description: The ornate box turtle is one of two turtle species on the Great Plains that are terrestrial.

item.title: EA Biome Objects Hack
item.description: A hack that modifies the biome objects from Extinct Animals.

item.title: Fire Pack
item.description: From the hidden island of Drom emerges mythical beasts of fire.

item.title: Gibbon Pack
item.description: A pack of three different gibbons to bring some variety to your zoos’ primate sections.

item.title: Lesser Flamingo
item.description: The lesser flamingo is herbivorous, feeding solely on a blue-green algae growing within a very limited range of pH.

item.title: Penguin Fountain
item.description: This penguin fountain will illuminate your penguin exhibits when guests pass by to view these little cuddly creatures.

item.title: Red Deer
item.description: Red deer have a reddish-brown coat, which changes to a brownish-grey in the winter.

item.title: Slender-horned Gazelle
item.description: The slender-horned gazelle is the palest gazelle species, with a cream or yellow-white coloured body.

item.title: Tibetan Blue Bear
item.description: The Tibetan blue bear is a sub-species of the brown bear found in the eastern Tibetan plateau.

item.title: Tree Elevated Path Pack
item.description: This pack contains 9 elevated paths, each made to resemble a tree from a different biome.

item.title: ZT2DC Gazebo
item.description: This download was created as a collaboration between many members for the first Skinning Collage Event at ZT2DC.

item.title: Amur Leopard
item.description: The Amur leopard is a wild feline predator native to the mountainous areas of the Russian Far East.

item.title: Amur Leopard Mini Pack
item.description: The Amur leopard is one of nine recognised subspecies of leopard.

item.title: Eurasian Wolf Mini Pack
item.description: The Eurasian wolf, also known as the European, common or forest wolf, is a subspecies of grey wolf which has the largest range among wolf subspecies.

item.title: Snowstalker
item.description: The Snowstalker is a species of mammal created for the film The Future is Wild. The Snowstalker is a saber-toothed mustelid, or weasel.

item.title: The Christmas Pack
item.description: Merry Christmas! The Christmas Pack is a collection of mods for Zoo Tycoon 2 that expound a winter theme.

item.title: The Christmas Pack 2: 7 Reasons to Celebrate
item.description: Merry Christmas! The Christmas Pack - 7 Reasons to Celebrate is the sequel to the collection of mods for Zoo Tycoon 2 that expound a winter theme.

item.title: Winter Kirin
item.description: The Winter Kirin is labeled as Critically Endangered not because it is threatened, but because all traces of them disappear off the face of the planet after the month of December.

item.title: Wooly Mammoth
item.description: Mammoth remains have been found in Europe, Africa, Asia, and North America.

item.title: Blue Poison Dart Frog
item.description: These little frogs are easily recognized by their blue color, which is generally darker on the limbs and belly and overlaid with black spots or patches.

item.title: Blue Roo
item.description: The Blue Kangaroo live in Tasmania and Australia and is happy in many biomes.

item.title: Blue-backed Gorilla
item.description: Blue-Backed Gorillas, as they are usually called, live high in the Alps, in the rainforests.

item.title: Caribbean Reef Squid
item.description: The Caribbean reef squid is found throughout the Caribbean Sea as well as off the coast of Florida.

item.title: Cassowary
item.description: Cassowaries are very large flightless birds native to the tropical forests of New Guinea and northeastern Australia.

item.title: Grimmace
item.description: This dark bear will be happy in any biome, even though Boreal is its main one.

item.title: Mainland Serow
item.description: The serow lives alone or in small groups. It is attached to its territory, which usually covers just a few miles square.

item.title: Red Eyed Tree Frog
item.description: The first thing you are bound to notice on this amphibian are the bold, bright red eyes.

item.title: Ribbon Eel
item.description: Ribbon eels are aptly named for their delicate movements, as they swim like a slender ribbon dancing in the water column.

item.title: Strawberry Dart Frog
item.description: The strawberry poison dart frog is common in the Atlantic lowland tropical forests of Central America.

item.title: Tarpan
item.description: The Tarpan is a prehistoric wild horse type that ranged from Southern France and Spain eastward to central and southern Russia and into nothern China.

item.title: Zebroid
item.description: A zebroid is a cross between a zebra and any other equid: essentially, a zebra hybrid.

item.title: Arctic Fox
item.description: Arctic foxes are pure white in winter and grey-brown in summer. They can also be light brown, grey, chocolate, or black with a bluish hue.

item.title: Black Lion
item.description: The black lion is only known to exist in the realm of fiction, folklore, and photoshop hoaxes.

item.title: Phoenix
item.description: The phoenix was originally believed to be a myth, until a group of American scientists discovered a large flock several hundred miles south of Egypt.

item.title: Spotted Hyena
item.description: Spotted hyenas are the largest member of the family Hyaenidae. This family also includes three other hyena species.

item.title: Turkey Raptor
item.description: The Turkey Raptor is a festive dromaeosaurid that only appears once a year, on Thanksgiving.

item.title: Wisent
item.description: This ungulate is also known as the European bison. Some authors consider it and the American bison to be conspecific.

item.title: African Bullfrog
item.description: A large species of frog from over a dozen African countries.

item.title: Bat Eared Fox
item.description: These foxes live in the scrub, savannah and grasslands of Africa.

item.title: Black Bear
item.description: The North American black bear is the best known and most widespread of the North American bears.

item.title: Bonobo
item.description: Bonobos live in the forests located centrally in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (formerly Zaire).

item.title: Bornean Pygmy Elephant
item.description: Borneo pygmy elephants have significantly different characteristics from their cousins found on mainland Asia and Sumatra.

item.title: Chacoan Peccary
item.description: The Chacoan peccary’s bristly coat is a speckled charcoal or brownish-grey, interspersed with long guard hairs.

item.title: Common Dolphin
item.description: Common dolphins can be found throughout the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

item.title: Crocodile Monitor
item.description: Generally arboreal, or tree dwelling. Crocodile monitors inhabit rainforests and adjacent savannas.

item.title: Douglas Squirrel
item.description: The Douglas squirrel lives from the Sierra Nevada mountains north through coastal British Colombia.

item.title: European Lion
item.description: Due to their remote extinction, little is known about this subspecies of lion.

item.title: Fire-bellied Toad
item.description: Despite the remarkably vivid coloring of its underbelly, the Oriental fire-bellied toad merges perfectly with its surroundings.

item.title: Jurrasic Bench
item.description: This bench will go perfectly alongside your Jurassic period species.

item.title: Lemur Donation Box
item.description: This donation box has a lemur instead of a monkey as well as the animals from Madagascar, the movie.

item.title: Mini Volcano
item.description: Guests will love this mini form of the volcano, especially when it is erupting steam.

item.title: Nile Monitor Lizard
item.description: The Nile monitor is distributed across most of Africa, except the northwest.

item.title: Piranha
item.description: These piranhas will form interesting schools in your jungle tanks.

item.title: Red Fox II
item.description: Red foxes are native to the Nearctic, Palearctic, Oriental, and Ethiopian regions, and have been introduced to areas in the Australian region.

item.title: Short Faced Bear Variant
item.description: This short-faced bear variant was designed by Angilas44 for the Extinct Variant Contest at ZT2DC.

item.title: Sloth Bear
item.description: Sloth bears live in the tropical rainforest of India.

item.title: Stone Table
item.description: A table made of stone for guests to eat on.

item.title: Styracosaurus Variant
item.description: This Styracosaurus variant was designed by Spike164uk for the Extinct Variant Contest at ZT2DC.

item.title: Styracosaurus Variant II
item.description: This Styracosaurus variant was designed by Exitree for the Extinct Variant Contest at ZT2DC.

item.title: Yacare Caiman
item.description: The yacare caiman is found in a variety of habitat types, often associated with floating mats of vegetation.

item.title: Zoo History Board
item.description: A board which shows the history of the zoo for guests to see.

item.title: Charming Cretaceous
item.description: A pack containing 15 Cretaceous era, JPOG styled dinosaurs.

item.title: Zoo Tycoon 2: Operation Genesis - Part 1
item.description: A pack containing various buildings, scenery and foliage imported from JPOG.

item.title: Red Fox
item.description: The most widespread carnivore in the world is ready for your zoos!

item.title: European Badger
item.description: European Badger skinned and coded by ShenTirag, with the model created by SilesianTomcat.

item.title: Dicynodont Pack
item.description: A pack of four dicynodonts, which are a group of therapsids the Permian and Triassic.

item.title: Hexaprotodon Pack
item.description: Three extinct hippopotamids from the genus Hexaprotodon.

item.title: Purple Hippo's Reskins
item.description: Four animal reskins by Purple Hippo, bundled together.

item.title: Rainbow Hippos
item.description: An adorable pygmy hippo for every color of the rainbow!

item.title: Rainbow Hippos Part 2: NOT Rainbow Hippos
item.description: What comes after the colors of the rainbow? The colors of the not rainbow apparently.

item.title: zzzanimal
item.description: ZG8gbm90IGRvd25sb2FkIHRoaXMu

item.title: Animal Crossing Signs
item.description: A set of sixteen animal crossing signs that warn visitors on foot or in jeep transports that various animals from around the world may cross their path.

item.title: Topiary Pack
item.description: This pack contains topiary versions of the lion, tiger and elephant fountains, as well as a matching low shrub hedge.

item.title: Bream
item.description: A freshwater fish from various types of waterways in Europe.

item.title: Domesticated Silver Fox (Siberian Fox)
item.description: A domesticated form of the silver morph of the red fox.

item.title: Pig Donation Box
item.description: A donation box that has a pig on it.

item.title: The Lost World Velociraptor
item.description: The vicious film raptor as it appeared in 1997’s The Lost World.

item.title: Yellow Stingray
item.description: A small reef-dwelling stingray.

item.title: Koi Carp
item.description: A domesticated cyprinid known for their wide range of color morphs.

item.title: Tiger Shark
item.description: A species of requiem shark and the only member of the genus Galeocerdo.

item.title: Update August 23, 2023
item.description: Concerning ZooBerry There is currently a bug I am trying to work out where lists aren’t completely sorted in order across all pagination. I can’t give an estimate when that will be fixed but hopefully soon! I am also looking into the issue where the authors list is trying to embed a thumbnail next to an author’s name in error. Files Added to ZooBerry Database on 08-05-2023 33 new files have been added to the ZooBerry database (Only Zoo Tycoon 2 this time).

item.title: Zoo Tycoon 1 Install Guide
item.description: Depending on the version of Zoo Tycoon 1 you own, the mod install directory might be different. The type of file you want to install might be important as well. Try these out and see which works for you. Table of Contents Important Installing Entity Mods Lang Files Installing Zoos Installing Scenarios Questions? Important Turn off the game: Though it shouldn’t cause any issues if we were to install a mod while your game is running, it makes sense to have it shut down so that any changes show up on a re-launch.

item.title: Zoo Tycoon 2 Install Guide
item.description: Depending on the version of Zoo Tycoon 2 you own, the mod install directory might be different. The type of file you want to install might be important as well. Try these out and see which works for you. Table of Contents Important Method 1 Method 2 Step 1 Step 2 Step 3 Installing Zoos and Maps Questions? Important Turn off the game: Though it shouldn’t cause any issues if we were to install a mod while your game is running, it makes sense to have it shut down so that any changes show up on a re-launch.

item.description: The American flamingo lives in the Coastal Biome.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Feel free to contact us if you have any questions or want to submit your own mod for publishing on ZooBerry. Table of Contents Submitting a new file File Policies Bug Reports Other queries Submitting a new file Want to submit a new file to ZooBerry? Email us at submit@goosifer.io Please make sure to include the following in your email: Author name(s) Compatibility (is your mod for Zoo Tycooon 1 or 2?

item.title: Disclaimer
item.description: Disclaimer ZooBerry is a fan-made platform dedicated to hosting user-created modifications (“mods”) for Zoo Tycoon, a video game developed and owned by Microsoft Corporation. We would like to emphasize that this website is not affiliated with or endorsed by Microsoft in any way. Zoo Tycoon and all related trademarks, logos, characters, and other assets are the property of Microsoft Corporation. The mods hosted on this website are created by the Zoo Tycoon community and are provided for informational and entertainment purposes only.

item.title: Licenses and Credits
item.description: Credits Thank you Jay and Fern Special thanks to Jay and Fern from the Zoo Tycoon Community Download Directory for their advice and great tips while I was getting my thoughts sorted about ZooBerry, and for all of their great work around the community in general! Thank you MJ, Lgcfm, and NanoLancensis Big thanks to MJ, Lgcfm, and NanoLancensis over on the Zoo Tycoon Discord for helping ‘rediscover’ some of our lost ZooMania files.

item.title: Links
item.description: Though ZooBerry does have a forum component where users may share mod progress threads, talk about Zoo Tycoon, or report ZooBerry issues, it is mostly meant to keep an open line of communication should anyone need to message us outside of email. There are many other fansites that you are welcome to check out. These are also a good resource if you have questions about Zoo Tycoon mods or how to make them.

item.title: On ZooBerry, Mod Authors, and Mod Licenses
item.description: Page updated on Jan 7, 2023 On ZooBerry, Mod Authors, and Mod Licenses Mods around the Zoo Tycoon scene, specifically for Zoo Tycoon 2, would sometimes have a license given by the author. Often the licenses would say “public domain” if the author was open to derivative mods based on their work. However, “public domain” has a very clear definition under US copyright law that we would rather not get into, especially since modding in general implies modification of proprietary game assets.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to ZooBerry Table of Contents Welcome to ZooBerry Hi, Welcome. ZooBerry Will you backup legacy mods from other forums not from ZooMania, Northern Skies, or Artifex? I’m a current Zoo Tycoon modder. May I submit files to ZooBerry for hosting? Mod ownership Community Hi, Welcome. My name is Goosifer, but I used to go by other usernames. A long time ago I used to help run a couple of Zoo Tycoon websites named ZooMania and Northern Skies.

item.title: Search
item.description: Search guide Use * asterisks before or after words to expand results. Do not use the asterisks if looking for exact words. Say we want to find anything with the word Ginger Simply search Ginger without asterisk if looking for Ginger Ging* will find Ginger or other words that start with Ging Ginger* won’t work. If you’re looking for Gingerella though, well, knock yourself out :P ZooBerry is a statically-generated website, which means performing a site search on Google.
